David Leger

Hey! My name's David.
I like to design things, and code stuff!

First, a bit about me.

I am a third year Software Engineering student at the University of New Brunswick. My favorite area to work in is front-end web development, but I also like back-end as well. I’m interested in learning new technologies and frameworks. My goal at the moment is to become a fullstack developer and a full process designer. However longterm, I just want to build something amazing! I’m driven by the philosophy that coding is not merely a technical skill but rather a medium for art.

Some work I've done.

Jul, 2015 - Present

AFL

Atlantic Football League

Website Manager

As the website manager for the Atlantic Football League, I am tasked with building and maintaining the league's website. This includes uploading news and media content, updating player stats and game scores, and more.

You can visit the website at: www.atlanticfootball.co

May, 2014 - Aug, 2014

UNB

UNB Faculty of Education

Website & Database Developer

As the only developer for the Faculty of Education at the University of New Brunswick, I built dynamic and responsive web applications with PHP, HTML, CSS/SCSS, and JavaScript/jQuery.

May, 2014 - Aug, 2014

Mariner

Mariner Innovations

Junior Program Analyst

At Mariner, I built COBOL/JCL analyzation tools to examine and visualize program interactions and database calls within large-scale applications. Used AWK, Batch, C# (Roslyn), Java (ANTLR), HTML, CSS, and Javascript (D3.js).
